snippet: Should free speech always trump the right to privacy?
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column advocates use of common sense solutions to online privacy issues; notes that rights granted to Europeans regarding how they are portrayed in Google search have not been extended to Americans; cites case in which one man had difficult time expunging photos of his dead brother from Internet, and another in which widow of race car driver Dale Earnhardt came to compromise with web and media companies regarding his image; holds latter case is preferable.
lead_paragraph: Should free speech always trump the right to privacy?

headline.seo: Some Material Ought to Be Delinked by Google
